definitions.definition: An English unit of land area ( symbol : a. or ac. ) originally denoting a day 's ploughing for a yoke of oxen , now standardized as 4,840 square yards or 4,046.86 square metres .

subdefinitions.definition: An area of 10,240 square yards or 4 quarters .

definitions.definition: Any of various similar units of area in other systems .

examples: I like my new house—there’s acres of space!

definitions.definition: The acre's breadth by the length , English units of length equal to the statute dimensions of the acre : 22 yd (≈20 m) by 220 yd (≈200 m).
A duel fought between individual Scots and Englishmen in the borderlands .

main_definition: An English unit of land area ( symbol : a. or ac. ) originally denoting a day 's ploughing for a yoke of oxen , now standardized as 4,840 square yards or 4,046.86 square metres .
secondary_definitions: Any of various similar units of area in other systems .
( informal , usually in the plural ) A wide expanse.
( informal , usually in the plural ) A large quantity.
( obsolete ) The acre's breadth by the length , English units of length equal to the statute dimensions of the acre : 22 yd (≈20 m) by 220 yd (≈200 m).
( obsolete ) A duel fought between individual Scots and Englishmen in the borderlands .
